newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigerian bourse regulator moves to new capital.
newsitem.headline: Nigerian bourse regulator moves to new capital.

text.p: Top officials of Nigeria's Securities and Exchange Commission have moved to the country's new federal capital Abuja in compliance with government directives, a senior official of the agency said on Thursday.
"The commission's key officials have completed the move ahead of the November 4 deadline for all ministries and parastatals," the official told Reuters.
He said most other employees would move next January although the Lagos office would remain open.
The commission, which regulates the stock market would continue to have a strong presence in Lagos, the commercial hub where most market activities still take place.
The bulk of trading on the Nigerian Stock Exchange takes place in Lagos but five smaller trading floors are scattered across the country. A sixth is planned for Abuja next year.
